channel.title: This might sound like a bit to ask
channel.description: I have a server folder, and i want to host it, yet i have a Mac. Is there anyway possibly to host it with my OS, or could i ask any of you to do it for me if i sent you the file?

item.title: This might sound like a bit to ask
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

ugh, you DO NOT NEED no-ip duc if your ip is static, meaning it does not change. (http://whatismyip.com - if that is the same all the time, and doesn’t change every few days, hours or so, then you do NOT need no-ip duc)… If it does change often/semi-often, then you have a dynamic ip, then you’ll need no-ip duc.

Read full topic
item.source: This might sound like a bit to ask

item.title: This might sound like a bit to ask
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

you can host with any os mate, I use Mac and linux, I no longer use windows. Run it from terminal.
[ java -Xmx256m server etc ]
